thread.section_title: Business & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Longtime BofA Directors Have Close Ties Outside Bank
thread.title_full: Longtime BofA Directors Have Close Ties Outside Bank - WSJ

author: Christina Rexrode
title: Longtime BofA Directors Have Close Ties Outside Bank
text:
Charles Gifford and Thomas May, the two longest-serving members of Bank of America Corp.’s board, are considered by most analysts and investors to be allies of CEO Brian Moynihan. They also have close ties outside the bank.
Messrs. Gifford, May and Moynihan all became part of Bank of America in 2004, when the Charlotte, N.C., bank bought FleetBoston Financial Corp. as a way to expand in the Northeast. Mr. Gifford was Fleet’s...
